types.name: IMSType
types.description: The type of the Issue management system. Currently only GitHub and ccims internal are available

enumValues.name: CCIMS
enumValues.description: The type of the Issue management system. Currently only GitHub and ccims internal are available

enumValues.name: GITHUB
enumValues.description: GitHub (or GitHub enterprise server) is the IMS for the component

enumValues.name: GITLAB
enumValues.description: Any instance of GitLab is used as issue management system

enumValues.name: JIRA
enumValues.description: Any instance of Jira is used as issue management system

enumValues.name: REDMINE
enumValues.description: Any instance of Redmine is used as issue management system

types.name: IssueCategory
types.description: The category of an issue. The issue will be displayed accordingly in the ccims

enumValues.name: BUG
enumValues.description: If an issue is classified _bug_ it describes an error, flaw or fault in one ore multiple component(s) or interface(s)

enumValues.name: FEATURE_REQUEST
enumValues.description: If an issue is defined a _feature request_, it describes a functionality that is to be implemented at some point

enumValues.name: UNCLASSIFIED
enumValues.description: The category for issues, that either weren't yet assigned to a category or that don't fit into one of the other categories

types.name: IssueTimelineItemType
types.description: The type of a timeline item/event so it can be filtered for <sup>(because GraphQL doesn't allow to filter for a type)</sup>

enumValues.name: ISSUE_COMMENT
enumValues.description: A still visible comment on an issue (not including the actual issue text)

enumValues.name: DELETED_ISSUE_COMMENT
enumValues.description: A comment that has been deleted by a user. This will contain no text etc., but a message should be shown in place of the comment stating that this is a deleted comment

enumValues.name: REFERENCED_BY_OTHER_EVENT
enumValues.description: An event when this issue was referenced by an element in an IMS that is not an issue (e.g. in a commit message, pull request etc.)

enumValues.name: REFERENCED_BY_ISSUE_EVENT
enumValues.description: An event when this issue was referenced by an other issue in an IMS or the ccims itself

enumValues.name: LINK_EVENT
enumValues.description: A link from this issue to another issue was created

enumValues.name: UNLINK_EVENT
enumValues.description: A link from this issue to another issue was removed

enumValues.name: WAS_LINKED_EVENT
enumValues.description: An event if this issue was linked to in another issue

enumValues.name: WAS_UNLINKED_EVENT
enumValues.description: An event if the link from another issue to this one was removed

enumValues.name: LABELLED_EVENT
enumValues.description: A label was added to this issue

enumValues.name: UNLABELLED_EVENT
enumValues.description: A label was removed from tis issue

enumValues.name: PINNED_EVENT
enumValues.description:
This issue was pinned as important issue in the ccims.

__This event won't be synced along all subscribed issue management systems__

enumValues.name: UNPINNED_EVENT
enumValues.description:
This issue was unpinned in the ccims.

__This event won't be synced along all subscribed issue management systems__

enumValues.name: RENAMED_TITLE_EVENT
enumValues.description: Occurs if the title of the issue has been changed

enumValues.name: CATEGORY_CHANGED_EVENT
enumValues.description: An event if the category (see `enum IssueCategory`) of the issue has been changed

enumValues.name: ASSIGNED_EVENT
enumValues.description: If a user has been assigned as responsible person for this issue

enumValues.name: UNASSIGNED_EVENT
enumValues.description: If a user has been unassigned from this issue and is no longer responsible

enumValues.name: CLOSED_EVENT
enumValues.description: Happens if the issue has been closed by anybody

enumValues.name: REOPENED_EVENT
enumValues.description:
Happens if the issue has been reopened after being closed by anybody.

_This event doesn't occur on the first opening of the issue_

enumValues.name: PRIORITY_CHANGED_EVENT
enumValues.description: If the issue priority was changed (see `enum Priority`)

enumValues.name: START_DATE_CHANGED_EVENT
enumValues.description: An event if the date the issue gets relevant/starts has changed

enumValues.name: DUE_DATE_CHANGED_EVENT
enumValues.description: An event if the date the issue is due on/must be finished by was changed

enumValues.name: ESTIMATED_TIME_CHANGED_EVENT
enumValues.description: The estimated time required to resolve this issue was updated

enumValues.name: ADDED_LOCATION_EVENT
enumValues.description: Event if the cross component issue was added to another location (another component/another)

enumValues.name: REMOVED_LOCATION_EVENT
enumValues.description: Event if the cross component issue was removed from a location (another component/another)

enumValues.name: MARKED_AS_DUPLICATE_EVENT
enumValues.description:
Occurs if this issue was marked as duplicate of some other issue which is known to the ccims.

(if the issue in unknown to the ccims at time of marking it as a duplicate; it's not guaranteed, that the mark will be synced)

enumValues.name: UNMARKED_AS_DUPLICATE_EVENT
enumValues.description: An event if the issue is no longer a duplicate of another issue

enumValues.name: ADDED_TO_COMPONENT_EVENT
enumValues.description: An event if the issue has been added to a new component and copied to the components ims (not a issue location)

enumValues.name: REMOVED_FROM_COMPONENT_EVENT
enumValues.description: An event if the issue has been removed from a component and deleted in the components ims (not a issue location)

types.name: Priority
types.description: The Priority which an issue has - how urgent it needs to be resolved

enumValues.name: LOW
enumValues.description: The issue has a low priority but higher than issues without priority

enumValues.name: DEFAULT
enumValues.description: The issue has a priority higher than low bot is not absolutely urgent

enumValues.name: HIGH
enumValues.description: Issues with this priority are __very__ urgent and need to be resolved quickly

types.name: Color
types.description:
A scalar type representing a colour in RGB colour space.
The scalar must be a string in CSS Colour Hex format:

`#rrggbb` where `rr`, `gg`, `bb` are the hex values between _0_ and _ff_

Example: `#ffff00` (would be a _beautiful_ yellow)

types.name: Date
types.description:
The `Date` scalar is a sting containing a date in a format compatible with _ISO-8601_

Example: `2011-10 - 10T14: 48: 00``

types.name: JSON
types.description:
The `JSON` scalar is a string in the a JSON format

Example: `{"numbers": [1,2,3,4]}`

types.name: TimeSpan
types.description:
A integer number representing the length of the time span in milliseconds

Example: `60000` (equivalent to a time span of one minute)

types.name: Node
types.description: An object which can be identified by an ID - called a node

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The ID of this node. Every node will have an non-empty and non-null edge.

If this is ever empty or null, something went wrong.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: ComponentFilter
types.description: Filters for component matching the given properties

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the component must match any of the given strings

inputFields.name: owner
inputFields.description: The owner of the component must have any of the given ids

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The components description must match the given __RegEx__

inputFields.name: imsType
inputFields.description: The IMS type of a component must be one of the given ones

types.name: ComponentInterfaceFilter
types.description: Filters for an instance of a component's interface

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name the component has to have

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: A Regex which the description of the interface needs to match

inputFields.name: component
inputFields.description: If given, only interfaces, that are __offered by__ one of the components with the IDs given can match the given filter

inputFields.name: consumedBy
inputFields.description: If given, only interfaces which are consumed by at least one of the components with the given ids can match the filter

types.name: IssueCommentFilter
types.description: Filter for comments on issues (not including the issue bodies themselves). All parameters given in this filter will be connected via _AND_

inputFields.name: issue
inputFields.description: The id of the issue the comment belongs to must match any of the given ids

inputFields.name: createdBy
inputFields.description: The id of the user creating the comment.Must match any one of the given ids

inputFields.name: editedBy
inputFields.description: The id of the user who __last__ edited the comment must match any of the given ids

inputFields.name: createdAfter
inputFields.description: Match all comments created after the given date (inclusive)

inputFields.name: createdBefore
inputFields.description: Match all comments created before the given date (inclusive)

inputFields.name: editedAfter
inputFields.description: Match all comments last edited after the given date (inclusive)

inputFields.name: editedBefore
inputFields.description: Match all comments last edited before the given date (inclusive)

inputFields.name: body
inputFields.description: The body of a comment must match this __RegEx__ to match the filter

inputFields.name: reactions
inputFields.description: A comment must have all the reactions in one of the lists given.

inputFields.name: currentUserCanEdit
inputFields.description: If given, filters for comments which the user either has or hasn't got edit permissions

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: IssueFilter
types.description:
Filters for Issues. All parameters given in this filter will be connected via _AND_

Not specific issues in issue management systems but the issue in the ccims

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description: The title of the issue must match the given regex

inputFields.name: components
inputFields.description: The issue must be on at least one of the components with the given ids

inputFields.name: body
inputFields.description: The body text of this issue must match this given __RegEx__

inputFields.name: createdBy
inputFields.description: The id of the user creating the issue must be any of the given ones

inputFields.name: editedBy
inputFields.description: The id of the user last editing the issue must match any of the ones in the list

inputFields.name: createdAfter
inputFields.description: The issue must have been created __after__ the given date (inclusive)

inputFields.name: createdBefore
inputFields.description: The issue must have been created __before__ the given date (inclusive)

inputFields.name: editedAfter
inputFields.description: The issue must have been last edited __after__ the given date (inclusive)

inputFields.name: editedBefore
inputFields.description: The issue must have been last edited __before__ the given date (inclusive)

inputFields.name: updatedAfter
inputFields.description: The last event in this issue must have occurred __after__ the given date (inclusive)

inputFields.name: updatedBefore
inputFields.description: The last event in this issue must have occurred __before__ the given date (inclusive)

inputFields.name: isOpen
inputFields.description: If given, filters for opened/closed issues

inputFields.name: isDuplicate
inputFields.description: If given, filters for issues which are/aren't duplicates of another issue

inputFields.name: category
inputFields.description: The issue must have any of the given categories to match the filter

inputFields.name: linksIssues
inputFields.description: If given, filters for issues which do/don't link __to__ other issues

inputFields.name: linkedIssues
inputFields.description: The issue must link __to__ at least one of the issues with the given ids

inputFields.name: reactions
inputFields.description: The issue (body text) must have all the reactions in one of the lists given.

inputFields.name: assignees
inputFields.description: Any of the users with the given ids must be an assignee to the issue for it to match this filter

inputFields.name: labels
inputFields.description: The issue must have at least one label with one of the given ids

inputFields.name: participants
inputFields.description: Any of the users with the given ids must be a participant to the issue for it to match this filter

inputFields.name: locations
inputFields.description: The issue must be assigned to at least one of the locations with the given ids

inputFields.name: currentUserCanEdit
inputFields.description: If given filters for issues the current user is allowed/not allowed to edit (the title and body text)

inputFields.name: currentUserCanComment
inputFields.description: If given filters for issues the current user is allowed/not allowed to write new comments on

inputFields.name: startDateAfter
inputFields.description: Filters for all issues that have a start date __after__ the give date

inputFields.name: startDateBefore
inputFields.description: Filters for all issues that have a start date __before__ the give date

inputFields.name: dueDateAfter
inputFields.description: Filters for all issues that have a due date __after__ the give date

inputFields.name: dueDateBefore
inputFields.description: Filters for all issues that have a due date __before__ the give date

inputFields.name: estimatedTimeGreaterThan
inputFields.description: Matches all issues that have an estimated time __greater or equal__ than the given one

inputFields.name: estimatedTimeLowerThan
inputFields.description: Matches all issues that have an estimated time __lower or equal__ than the given one

inputFields.name: spentTimeGreaterThan
inputFields.description: Matches all issues that have an actual spent time __greater or equal__ than the given one

inputFields.name: spentTimeLowerThan
inputFields.description: Matches all issues that have an actual spent time __lower or equal__ than the given one

types.name: IssueLocationFilter
types.description: Filters for Issues locations (components and interfaces). All parameters given in this filter will be connected via _AND_

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the location must match one of the gien strings

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The issue locations description must match the given __RegEx__

types.name: IssueTimelineItemFilter
types.description:
Filters for certain timeline events. All parameters given in this filter will be connected via _AND_

__Please note:__ It's currently __not__ possible to filter for specific properties of an event. Might be added in future

inputFields.name: createdBy
inputFields.description: Filters for the creator user of the timeline event. The id of the user must match any of the given ids

inputFields.name: createdAfter
inputFields.description: The timeline event must have occurred after the given date (inclusive) to match the filter

inputFields.name: createdBefore
inputFields.description: The timeline event must have occurred before the given date (inclusive) to match the filter

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: The type of the timeline item must match one of the given ones

types.name: LabelFilter
types.description: A Filter data input for labels.  All parameters given in this filter will be connected via _AND_

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: A lists of names. The label needs to match any one or more of these.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The __RegEx__ the description of the label needs to match

inputFields.name: createdBy
inputFields.description: Filters for the creator user of the label. The id of the user must match any of the given ids

inputFields.name: createdAfter
inputFields.description: The label must have been created after the given date (inclusive) to match the filter

inputFields.name: createdBefore
inputFields.description: The label must have been created before the given date (inclusive) to match the filter

inputFields.name: color
inputFields.description: A list of label colours. Any one or more of the given colours need to match the labels colour.

types.name: ProjectFilter
types.description: Filter for a Project. All parameters given in this filter will be connected via _AND_

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the project must match the given RegEx

inputFields.name: components
inputFields.description: The project must have any of the components with the given ids

inputFields.name: users
inputFields.description: At least one of the users with the given ids must be part of the project

inputFields.name: owner
inputFields.description: The Owner of the project must be a user with one of the given ids

inputFields.name: issues
inputFields.description: At least one of the issues given must be on a component assigned to the project

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The projects description must match the given __RegEx__

types.name: ReactionGroupFilter
types.description: A filter for reaction groups (a reaction together with the users who reacted). All parameters given in this filter will be connected via _AND_

inputFields.name: reaction
inputFields.description: The reactions name must match this regex

inputFields.name: users
inputFields.description: A list of Users who reacted. Any reaction group which contains at least one of the given users will match the filter

types.name: UserFilter
types.description: Filter for a user of the system. All parameters given in this filter will be connected via _AND_

inputFields.name: username
inputFields.description: The users username must match this given RegEx

inputFields.name: displayName
inputFields.description: The users display name must match this given RegEx

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: The users email must match this given RegEx

inputFields.name: projects
inputFields.description: The user must be member of at least one of the projects with the given ids

inputFields.name: assignedToIssues
inputFields.description: The user must be assigned to at least one of the issues with the given ids

inputFields.name: participantOfIssues
inputFields.description: The user must be participant of at least one of the issues with the given ids

inputFields.name: comments
inputFields.description: The user must have written or edited at least one of the comments (issue or comment) with the given ids

types.name: Comment
types.description: An interface specifying an editable text block (e.g. Issue, Comment)

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique id of this comment

fields.name: body
fields.description:
The body text of the comment.
Markdown supported.

Max. 65536 characters

fields.name: bodyRendered
fields.description: The body text of the comment rendered to html

fields.name: createdBy
fields.description: The user who originally created the comment (in ccims or any ims)

fields.name: editedBy
fields.description: A list of all people who edited the root of this comment (body and title)

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The date the comment was first created on

fields.name: lastEditedAt
fields.description: Date when the core comment(title, body etc.) was last changed (comments and other events DO NOT count)

fields.name: currentUserCanEdit
fields.description:
`true` iff the user authenticated by the given JWT is permitted to edit this comment.

This only refers to editing the core comment (title, body, etc.)

fields.name: reactions
fields.description: All reactions that have been added to this comment

args.name: after
args.description: Returns only reactions AFTER one with the given cursor (exclusive)

args.name: before
args.description: Returns only reactions BEFORE the one with the given cursor (exclusive)

args.name: filterBy
args.description: Only reactions matching this filter will be returned

args.name: first
args.description: Only return the first _n_ reactions matching the filter

args.name: last
args.description: Only return the last _n_ reactions matching the filter

types.name: Component
types.description:
A component known to ccims.

A component can have issues and can be assigned to multiple projects. (NOTE: One IMS per component)

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique id of this component

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The (non unique) display name of this component

Max. 256 characters

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The user who administrates "owns" the component

fields.name: description
fields.description:
A textual description (of the fuction) of this component.

Max. 65536 characters

fields.name: ims
fields.description: The IMS instance used by this component.

fields.name: issues
fields.description: All issues that are mirrored on this component (not the issue location but the ims) matching (if given) `filterBy`

args.name: after
args.description: Returns only issues AFTER one with the given cursor (exclusive)

args.name: before
args.description: Returns only issues BEFORE the one with the given cursor (exclusive)

args.name: filterBy
args.description: Only issues matching this filter will be returned

args.name: first
args.description: Only return the first _n_ issues matching the filter

args.name: last
args.description: Only return the last _n_ issues matching the filter

fields.name: issuesOnLocation
fields.description: All issues that are assigned to this components issue location matching (if given) `filterBy`

args.name: after
args.description: Returns only issues AFTER one with the given cursor (exclusive)

args.name: before
args.description: Returns only issues BEFORE the one with the given cursor (exclusive)

args.name: filterBy
args.description: Only issues matching this filter will be returned

args.name: first
args.description: Only return the first _n_ issues matching the filter

args.name: last
args.description: Only return the last _n_ issues matching the filter

fields.name: projects
fields.description: All projects that this component is assigned to matching the `filterBy`

args.name: after
args.description: Returns only projects AFTER one with the given cursor (exclusive)

args.name: before

types.name: Query
types.description: All queries for requesting stuff

fields.name: node
fields.description: Requests an object (node) using the given ID. If the given ID is invalid an error will be returned

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the node to return. This can't be empty or null

fields.name: echo
fields.description: Returns the string which is given as input

args.name: input
args.description: The String to be returned

fields.name: projects
fields.description: Requests all projects within the current ccims instance mathcing the `filterBy`

args.name: after
args.description: Returns only projects AFTER one with the given cursor (exclusive)

args.name: before
args.description: Returns only projects BEFORE the one with the given cursor (exclusive)

args.name: filterBy
args.description: Only projects matching this filter will be returned

args.name: first
args.description: Only return the first _n_ projects matching the filter

args.name: last
args.description: Only return the last _n_ projects matching the filter

fields.name: currentUser
fields.description: Returns the user from which the PAI is currently being accessed

fields.name: checkUsername
fields.description:
Checks wether the given username is still available or already taken.

`true` is returned if the username is available and __NOT__ take
`false, if it __IS__ already taken and can't be used for a new user

args.name: username
args.description: The username to be checked for availability

types.name: TestMutationPayload
types.description: The Payload/Response for the addIssueToLocation mutation

fields.name: clientMutationID
fields.description: The string provided by the client on sending the mutation

types.name: TestMutationInput
types.description: The inputs for the testMutation

inputFields.name: clientMutationID
inputFields.description: An arbitraty string to return together with the mutation result

types.name: CreateIssuePayload
types.description: The Payload/Response for the createIssue mutation

fields.name: clientMutationID
fields.description: The string provided by the client on sending the mutation

fields.name: issue
fields.description: The created issue node

types.name: CreateIssueInput
types.description: The inputs for the createIssue

inputFields.name: clientMutationID
inputFields.description: An arbitraty string to return together with the mutation result

inputFields.name: title
inputFields.description:
The human readable title for the new issue.

This can't be `null`. Max. 256 caracters.

inputFields.name: body
inputFields.description:
The body text for the issue as markdown.

This can be `null` (will result in an empty body). Max. 65536 characters

inputFields.name: componentIDs
inputFields.description:
The IDs of the components the issue is mirrored to.

At least one valid component must be given.

inputFields.name: category
inputFields.description:
The category to assign the issue to.

If none is given, the issue wil have the category `UNCLASSIFIED`.

inputFields.name: labels
inputFields.description:
A list of all label IDs to assign to the new issue.

If `null`, none will be assigned.

inputFields.name: assignees
inputFields.description:
A list of user IDs to added as assignees to the issue.

If `null`, no users will be assigned

inputFields.name: locations
inputFields.description:
A list of IDs of issue locations to add the issue to.

If `null`, the issue will not be assigned to any locations

inputFields.name: startDate
inputFields.description:
The start date to be set for the issue.

If `null`, none will be set

inputFields.name: dueDate
inputFields.description:
The due date to be set for the issue.

If `null`, none will be set

inputFields.name: estimatedTime
inputFields.description:
The estimated time to be set for the issue.

If `null`, none will be set

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
